author: mratsim
content:
<@!555483069038198827> regarding the FFT optimization you did, I'm sure <@!612786210829631525> and I could start something right away.
I have access to BLST add/mul internals, and it's exposed in Rust as well: https://github.com/supranational/blst/blob/master/bindings/rust/src/bindings.rs#L215-L232

Alternatively, we can model your FFT in a "reference" implementation in SageMath and produce test vectors.

For example this test vector generator https://github.com/mratsim/constantine/blob/master/sage/testgen_scalar_mul.sage
will create scalar multiplication vectors on G1 and G2, output example: https://github.com/mratsim/constantine/blob/master/tests/vectors/tv_BLS12_381_scalar_mul_G2.json#L1-L42
